Posts.EditableText: The first draft of the QDK Tutorial is almost ready, and I'm looking for willing testers - whether you know hardly anything about QDK, or if you know a lot. Please send an email to me at alex@axeuk.com and I'll send you the tutorial when it is ready, together with a link to the beta version of Quest and QDK 4.0 if you've not already got it. The tutorial is currently a 44-page PDF file, and depending on how much you know already, it make take you a while to get through. The finished tutorial will be part of the Quest 4.0 download, and I also plan to make it available together with the reference guide as a print-on-demand book, which should be nice. As with the beta, I'll reward good feedback with free copies or upgrades of Quest Pro, as well as copies of the finished book or Amazon vouchers for particularly good feedback.
Posts.HTML:
The first draft of the QDK Tutorial is almost ready, and I'm looking for willing testers - whether you know hardly anything about QDK, or if you know a lot.

Please send an email to me at alex@axeuk.com and I'll send you the tutorial when it is ready, together with a link to the beta version of Quest and QDK 4.0 if you've not already got it.

The tutorial is currently a 44-page PDF file, and depending on how much you know already, it make take you a while to get through. The finished tutorial will be part of the Quest 4.0 download, and I also plan to make it available together with the reference guide as a print-on-demand book, which should be nice.

As with the beta, I'll reward good feedback with free copies or upgrades of Quest Pro, as well as copies of the finished book or Amazon vouchers for particularly good feedback.

Posts.EditableText:
I was following the QDK Tutorial using Quest 4.0 Beta 2 and descovered a serious error.

Following the tutorial 

Create new game

   What do you call this game?                House
   Your Name?                                       Steve
   Where do you want to save this game? DESKTOP FOLDER 'Quest'
   FILE NAME : House

   Additional Verbs (Off/On) Makes no difference

   Add Rooms : Lounge / Kitchen (you can check either or none)

   Click Ok

   run-time error '91' 

   object vairiable or With block vairiable not set

This does not happen if you add one room.
did not happen with Beta 1

Steve

Posts.EditableText: I've now updated the Beta 2 package to fix this, so if you download again and reinstall this should work properly.
Posts.HTML: I've now updated the Beta 2 package to fix this, so if you download again and reinstall this should work properly.
